concept.title: Folder and File Name Pattern
concept.shortdesc: The Amazon S3 origin processes files based on the user-defined location and pattern of the file name to be read. You can process files in a single folder or a set of folders. To define a set of folders, include a directory in the file name pattern and use wildcards to define a glob pattern.

conbody.p: Note that the origin does not process files recursively in unspecified subdirectories. It processes files in the specified folder or directories defined by a glob pattern.
For example, to read all CSV files in the East Coast folder, you can use "East Coast" for the folder name and "*.csv" for the file name pattern.

But say the East Coast folder includes a separate folder for each state, and you use the slash as the path delimiter. To read all CSV files in each state folder, you can leave the folder property empty, and then use the following for the file name pattern: "East Coast/*/*.csv".

With this configuration, the Amazon S3 origin processes all *.csv files in the first level of East Coast subdirectories. The origin does not process any CSV files in the East Coast folder or in folders nested in the subdirectories.
